addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my very singular good Lord
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

28 N
o
1591
. M
r
Bodeleie to my L.
By
Ca
p
Lambert.

page.lettertext:
fol.240r
May it please yo
r
good L. to be advertised,
at
there is freshe intel ligence come hither to the
Count of Hohenlo
,
at
e
K. of Spaine
doth make
newe levies in
Germany,
both of horse and foote:
of w
ch
there are 16 companies of horse, every
company contening 300 under
e conduct of
Coronel
Slegel
,
Schoonenberch,
Echenberch,
and
Sinbelmont,
who have eche
e commaunding of
4 companies. There are likewise two regi-
ments of footmen,
at make 30 Enseignes, of w
ch
e charge is eq
a
lly devided between
Duke Maurice
and
Coronel Brennen
. There are
certaine Ambassado
rs
sent hither from
e bishop of
Liege,
to negotiat a better agreement between
e bishop and these contreis. For
e land of Liege
Collen,
Munster,
and
Westphalia,
w
ch
are held
for neutral places, are greatly dammified by
e fributing souldiers of
e states, w
t
out any
benefit to
e General cause. These Ambass-
do
rs
make report,
at for certaine
e
Empero
r
is
resolved to send unto her
Ma
tie
to
e self same
ende, as to
e states, to persuade her to a treaty.
Howbeit there is an other come lately to
e Hage
from
Cassimire,
but whether it be for
e Dukes
affaires, or for his privat occasions, I can not yet
learne. His name is
Bassem,
who hath bin im-
ploied by the Duke heeretofore, in some buisnes to
her Ma
tie
. This party declareth, that
e Princes
of Germany that are Spanishe, give it out,
at
her Ma
tie
hath sent of purpose to
e Empero
r
to induce him to this action of intercession,
fol.240v
between
e Spaniard and
e states. Albeit I
knowe no further of it, then I signifie unto yo
w
,
yet I thought it not unmeete, to certifie what
is bruited.
And so I take my humble leave.
From
e Hage. N
o
28 1591.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
